item.title: Leah add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Far better it is to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure, than to take rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy much nor suffer much, because they live in the gray twilight that knows neither victory nor defeat." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Leah add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "But nature is always more subtle, more intricate, more elegant than what we are able to imagine." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Leah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Loyalty to a petrified opinion never yet broke a chain or freed a human soul." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Leah add a quote by Stephen Jay Gould
item.description: "Scientists have power by virtue of the respect commanded by the discipline... We live with poets and politicians, preachers and philosophers. All have their ways of knowing, and all are valid in their proper domain. The world is too complex and interesting for one way to hold all the answers." -- Stephen Jay Gould

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven.." -- John Milton

item.title: Leah add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "The more articulate one is, the more dangerous words become." -- May Sarton

item.title: Leah add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Whatever you are, be a good one." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Leah add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Leah add a quote by Rosalind Russell
item.description: "Taking joy in life is a woman's best cosmetic." -- Rosalind Russell

item.title: Leah add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Leah add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "The thing about life is that you must survive. Life is going to be difficult, and dreadful things will happen. What you do is move along, get on with it, and be tough. Not in the sense of being mean to others, but being tough with yourself and making a deadly effort not to be defeated." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Leah add a quote by Rachel Sontag
item.description: "A void in my chest was beginning to fill with anger. Quiet, defeated anger that guaranteed me the right to my hurt, that believed no one could possibly understand that hurt." -- Rachel Sontag
